name: Standing Rope Forearm
how_to_perform:
* Stand facing a set of pull-up bars with the rope attachment, shoulder-width apart and feet on either side of your body.\
2. Keeping your body straight, lean forward slightly and grip the rope with an overhand grip (palms facing downwards).\
3. Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine to maintain a stable position.\
4. Keeping your arms straight and pulling against the rope, press down on it while maintaining this position for 5-10 seconds, focusing on contraction in the forearms.\
5. Release your grip on the rope slowly and return to the starting position, feeling the stretch in the forearms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The Standing Rope Forearm exercise is a forearm-focused strength training routine that targets the flexors of the wrist and hand. It works best with a pull-up bar equipped with rope attachment.
